title: Restore Previous Session - Option to keep more?
content:
Is there an option to restore not just the previous session, but the session before that?

It seems it wipes everything on each close, I figure that might be a security feature, but it would be really helpful if there was a plugin/add-on or better yet an option to keep session up to X amount. Since firefox is my default broswer sometimes I will open a link thru an app and close it, forgetting that it will delete my previous session. Then it is impossible to open up those tabs again as I keep them open for a while.

Please let me know if there is an easy solution to this.

Sincerely, Dylan I
creator: dylnki

title: [Win11]Freeze firefox window when RDP connection from Win10.
content:
I replaced my Desktop PC is Win11.Sometimes RDP connect from laptop(Win10). When I'm running Firefox in Desktop,Connect from laptop.Then Firefox windows is minimize and freeze(window is whiteout and very small image. attached)

occurred pattern.

  • Connect from Win10 PC to Win11 PC
  • Open Firefox window in Win11 PC directly.(not occurred in open with RDP connection/reconnect)
  • Occurred in Firefox with safemode.
  • Doesn't open Crash Reporter and the log is not in about:crashes.
  • Occurred in newer Firefox version.(maybe 101 or later? Not occurred in Firefox ESR)
creator: HKJP

title: youtube suddenly stops loading
content: Recently I have been getting an error where after some point in time youtube-related pages will stop loading when I try to open them or if they do load they will tell me I am not connected to the internet despite being connected to the internet. It will have occasional brief windows where it will load the site again before going back to not working but I have no idea what causes this change. I have tried clearing my cache/cookies and disabling my add-ons but neither of those things stop this from happening. Interestingly, if I restart in troubleshoot mode or open a private window, youtube will load perfectly. Any suggestions on what I can do to fix this issue?
creator: kai_draws

title: passwords disappeared
content:
moving from pc to mac. all is going great. download and install firefox. sign in and sync. all good. start cleaning up old passwords (no more microsoft email i never used, etc.). then i see a yellow triangle on my icon in the address bar. click. says i'm not logged in. hm. so i log back in.

and all my passwords are gone except for the brand new firefox password i just created. that's it.

thank goodness i had the pc open and was able to immediately make html and csv copies of bookmarks & passwords from it, but firefox had the yellow triangle again. wasn't going to log in that time and lose everything.

my question is this: there is ZERO information on how to import the .csv file into firefox. i can't figure it out. please don't put the same link i've followed five times already before seeing what it looks like now. it's worthless.

so. how do i get my 132 passwords back?

thank you.
